meanings.definition: A system of millions or billions of stars, together with gas and dust, held together by gravitational attraction.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study galaxies to learn more about the stars and planets within them.
meanings.sent2: The telescope allowed us to see distant galaxies in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The aliens traveled through galaxies to find the perfect vacation spot.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a galaxy of thoughts, swirling and shining with ideas.
meanings.sent5: The Milky Way is one of the most famous galaxies in our universe.

meanings.definition: Any of the very large groups of stars and associated matter that are found throughout the universe.
meanings.sent1: A galaxy can contain billions of stars, creating a beautiful cosmic display.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers have discovered new galaxies using advanced technology.
meanings.sent3: The galaxy of students in the classroom was buzzing with excitement.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, he saw a galaxy of emotions swirling beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The galaxy of flowers in the garden bloomed in a riot of colors.
